Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Hydramacin-1 (HM-1, UCSS1a; natural AMPs; Metazoan; animals; 4S=S)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: It is the founding member of the macin family.Chemical modification:  It consists of 4 conserved disulfide bonds: C1-C6, C2-C5, C3-C7, and C4-C8.Activity: LD90: 90% lethal dose. active against Gram-  A. baumannii ATCC 19606 (LD90 1.8 uM), C. freundii NCTC 9750 or C7 (LD90 0.5-0.9 uM), E. cloacae Va11263/03 or Va12270/03 (LD90 0.5-0.9 uM), E. coli ATCC 25922 or Co 86 ESBL (LD90 0.2-0.9 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 or ATCC 700603 ESBL (LD90 0.5-0.9 uM), K. oxytoca ATCC 13182 or ESBL 33 (LD90 0.5-0.9 uM), P. mirabilis ATCC 21100 (LD90 0.9 uM), P. vulgaris ATCC 13315 (LD90 3.6 uM), P-rettgeri NCTC 7475 (LD90 >14.3 uM), P. aeruginosa NCTC 11446 (LD90 14.3 uM), S. typhimurium 10003442 or 10003630 (LD90 0.5 uM), S. marcescens Mero060/148 or Mero103/013 or NCTC 10211 (LD90 1.8-14.3 uM), Y. enterocolitca NCTC 11176 (LD90 0.2 uM), Gram+ S-aureus ATCC 6538 or MRSA (LD90 >14.3 uM), S. hemolyticus ATCC 29970 (LD90 0.9 uM), E. faecalis ATCC 51299 anti-VRE (LD90 7.1 uM), and S. pyogenes ATCC 12344 (LD90 7.1 uM).Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli:The peptide was recombinantly expressed as fusion protein in E. coli strain BL21 (DE3).Structure:  A uniformly 13C,15N-labeled peptide was producted for heteronuclear NMR studies. Of outstandding interest is that a belt of positively charged residues is sandwiched by TWO hydrophobic patches on the peptide surface. Such a structural feature provides a model for explaining bacterial aggregation by this AMP.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.Updated 2/2014; 2/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Jung S, Dingley AJ, Augustin R, Anton-Erxleben F, Stanisak M, Gelhaus C, Gutsmann T, Hammer MU, Podschun R, Bonvin AM, Leippe M, Bosch TC, Gr√∂tzinger J.2009
Literature Information.Title: Hydramacin-1, structure and antibacterial activity of a protein from the basal metazoan Hydra
